author: Special Correspondent
text:
Four youths in the age group of 17 to 20 years were arrested in a robbery case in Tirupparankundram on Monday. The police said Kathirvel (31) of Thenparankundram, employed in a private company, was walking near the Sri Anjaneya Temple near the Railway Station at around 10 p.m. on Sunday.

Three youths who intercepted him pushed him down and gagged him. They also snatched Rs. 800 and a mobile phone from him. He was assaulted as a result he had bleeding injuries on his face.

Based on a complaint from him, the Tirupparankundram police arrested three persons including, one undergoing graduation in a local college and another accused who had undergone a vocational course. The Inspector of Police (Tirupparankundram), A. Nagarajan, said the boys were under the influence of liquor. The mobile phone was recovered from a youth, who was part of the four-member gang.
title: Four youths arrested
